@metadata.NOTE: Use checkStrings.js to determine what needs to be translated.

txt-advised: $1 has asked for advice from the robot
eml-html-link: Click here to join the game.
eml-invited: You have been invited to play XANADO
eml-remind: It is your turn in your XANADO game
eml-reset: Click here to reset your password.
eml-resplain: Follow this link to reset your password: $1
eml-text-link: Join the game by following this link: $1
lbl-1-win: Join games in the same browser window
lbl-place-snd: Play a sound when a tile is placed
lbl-turn-snd: Play a sound when it's your turn
log-fromracks: $1 gained $2 {{PLURAL:$2|point|points}} from the racks of other players
log-no-more: $1 has no more tiles, game will be over unless you challenge
log-no-tiles: You have no more tiles, game will be over if your play isn't challenged
nfy-chall-wonB: $1 has successfully challenged your turn. You have lost the $2 {{PLURAL:$2|point|points}} you scored, and the tiles you played are back on your rack
nfy-theyfailB: $1 challenged your turn, but the dictionary backed you up
nfy-your-turnB: $1 has taken their turn and now it is your turn
played-for: $1 asked the robot to play for them
player-unknown: Player '$1' is not known. Use the 'Sign up' tab to register.
possible-score: $1 at row $2 column $3 would have scored $4
tt-add-robot: Add a robot player to this game
tt-allow-undo: Allow players to undo previous plays
tt-can-chall: Select whether the robot player can issue challenges
tt-chall-type: You can subtract points for each correct word that is challenged, simply subtract a fixed number of points, or make the challenger miss their next turn
tt-check-type: You can check words after the play is committed (only the player is told if the word is valid) or have the computer reject unknown words
tt-dictionary: A dictionary is optional for human player games, but you can select one to use to automatically check challenges. A dictionary is required for computer players
tt-edition: Select the game you want to play
tt-invite: Send emails to invite people to join the game
tt-invite-mess: Add a message that will be included in the invitation email
tt-join: Join the game and open it in a new window
tt-jqTheme: Choose a display theme for dialogs
tt-lang: Choose a supported language code (e.g. 'en' is English)
tt-leave: If you leave the game your score will still count towards the leader board.
tt-look-feel: Select a 'look and feel' for the game board
tt-max-players: Limit the total number of players who can join this game
tt-max-time: For 'Turn timer', this is the maximum time allowed to take a turn. For 'Game timer' this is the total amount of time a player has to play all their moves before incurring penalties
tt-min-players: Require at least this many players to join before starting the game. A start player won't be assigned until enough players have joined
tt-new-pass: Enter a new password. Empty passwords are discouraged, but will work
tt-observe: Open a board to watch the game, but not play
tt-obsname: Name by which you want to be known to others in the game
tt-open: Open this game in a new window.
tt-pause: Pause the game; stops timers for all players until someone unpauses the game again
tt-points-lost: Number of points lost for an incorrect challenge, either per turn, or per correct word
tt-predict: Predict score for the play as the player places each tile. Turn this off if you want the player to calculate their own score, for example during tournament play
tt-reg-email: Leave blank if you don't want to get emails from XANADO. Emails only relate to gameplay, and addresses are never shared with anyone else
tt-reg-name: Name you want to be known as in games
tt-register-pw: Use something you can easily remember. Never re-use a password you use on another site
tt-remove-robot: Remove the robot from this game.
tt-robot-dic: You can choose a different (usually smaller) dictionary for the robot player to choose words from. 'None' will make it play words from the main Dictionary
tt-robot-wait: How many seconds the robot must wait before it can play. Setting this longer gives the previous player more time to take back their move (or to think!)
tt-sendrem: Email a reminder to player whose turn it is
tt-sendrems: Email reminders to players whose turn it is
tt-share: Copy a link to this game
tt-signin-name: Name of an existing XANADO user
tt-takeback: Let the player who has just played take their move back before the next player has challenged or played
tt-time-pen: 'Game timer' only; points lost for each minute the player has gone over their allotted time. Default is 5 points
tt-turn-timer: 'Turn timer' lets you set a maximum time for each player to play before they are forced to pass. 'Game timer' is like a chess clock, it lets you set a total amount of time a player has to play all their moves before incurring penalties
txt-blank-dlg: Select the letter for the blank
txt-click-name: Click on a player's name below to remove them from the list
txt-forgot: Lost your password? Please enter the email you registered with, and we'll send you a reset link.
txt-no-email: Sorry, but email is not available on this server. You will have to ask the server admin for your password.
txt-observer: You are not playing in this game
txt-or-email: Or type the email address of someone who is not listed, and click 'Add'
txt-or-xanado: or sign in as XANADO user:
txt-reset-sent: Password reset email has been sent
txt-signin: To play in a game you have to sign in first. You may be able to sign in using a public service, such as Google or Facebook, or you can create your own XANADO user.
warn-2-tiles: First word must be at least two tiles
txt-was-advised: $1 has received advice from the robot
txt-word-rejected: The {{PLURAL:$1|word|words}} $2 {{PLURAL:$1|was|were}} not found in the dictionary
